column4: I have a machine which goes to dark screen after a given user logs in but can't see errors. I can ssh in. What log do I need to see what is wrong ?
dark for every user, or one user?
that's a little involved but I think in short, just the one
if its just the one, I'd look in that users home directory (verify they have one) for files like .xinitrc and see if they have something bizarre configured
ok have access to the users home drive. where is .xinitrc
it'd be in their home directory
hm, if its only for this one user, than it must be some configuration setting of this user
so its got to be one of the files in there... are you using Gnome?
and I agree it is probably some setting as this user worked fine before.
do they have any weird files/directories in their home dir that start with .x?
no other ideas ? I'm wondering about in the home dir but nothing stands out
thanks for trying, giving up for now, time to do some work
